creator: halleux.jf@skynet.be
text:
A JSP page containing an empty page directive should not be accepted.
e.g. 

<%@page %>

<html>
....
</html>

should result in a translation error.

JFH

creator: kin-man.chung@sun.com
text:
None of the attribtes for page directive is mandatary, so it is not required
that one be specified.  Maybe a warning should be given if none is specified,
but there's no such thing in Jasper.  One can also argue that that Jasper should
just silently ignore the page directive in such a case.  "Fixing" it may break
currently running jsp pages.

I thought that at least the language attribute was required :

"In JSP 1.2, the only defined and required scripting language value for this 
attribute is "java"", JSP 1.2 Spec, page 49.

JFH
creator: halleux.jf@skynet.be
kin-man.chung@sun.com
text:
That only means that IF a language attribute is specified, its value can only
be  "java", and the container (or jasper) is required to support it.  Note also
that there are examples on page 48 for page directives that don't  have the
language attribute specified.
